location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bowyear, East India Company Resident at Bushire, to George Skipp, at Schyrass [Shiraz]

mods.abstract: The letter sets out suggestions for issues to be raised with the Caun [Karim Khan] during Skipp's negotiations with him, including reducing the duties paid by the Company on goods in Persia and the need to get consent from Shaik Nassir [Sheikh NƒÅsir] for a fixed rent at Bushire of 1000 Rupees a year.
